metadata.synopsis: The dialog on the entrance to the extraplanar circus, where the player sees a ghoul sniffing entering customers - new measures because of the recent murders nearby. The player can pay an entrance fee and go and see the circus.
metadata.how_to_trigger: Use the debug book to got to act 3, wyrm's crossing, Circus of the Last Days. You will be teleported to directly outside the circus gates - click on the ghoul or the man next to him to start this dialogue.

21.speaker: Klaus
21.text: Now, now - you didn't pass the sniff test. Which means no circus for you - off you go!
21.context: NodeContext: Dismissive shooing gesture - like to a dog. (player isn't allowed into the circus)

61.speaker: Karlach
61.text: Ah! A circus! Can we go?!
61.context: NodeContext: First 'Ah' is meant to be a childlike gasp of excitement. Think bouncing on her toes with enthusiasm to go inside.

74.speaker: Benji
74.text: *Sniff.* STINKS of CHEESE. *Sniff.* Between his PIGGY TOES.

88.speaker: Montgomery
88.text: How dare you! What in the hells is all of this?

125.speaker: Klaus
125.text: A necessity, good sir! The Steel Watch loves pretending sweet Rivington doesn't exist.
125.context: NodeContext: cheerful - used to handling difficult customers.

17.speaker: Klaus
17.text: So we have decided to protect you, dear patrons. No need to thank us. You'll be allowed in once I've done this batch - next!
17.context: NodeContext: diverting customers outrage lie a pro. Cheerful.

71.speaker: Klaus
71.text: Hello, hello, and welcome to the Circus of the Last Days - the finest extraplanar circus there is!

81.speaker: Karlach
81.text: Ah! A circus! Can we go?!
81.context: NodeContext: First 'Ah' is meant to be a childlike gasp of excitement. Think bouncing on her toes with enthusiasm to go inside.

3.speaker: Narrator
3.text: *This entire place practically vibrates with a familiar, excitable magic. You feel your patron giggle from afar - it's fey magic.*

99.speaker: Player
99.text: I've never heard of an 'extraplanar circus'.

47.speaker: Klaus
47.text: We travel from plane to plane, thrilling all blessed to see us! From tempestuous djinni to belligerent redcaps - you'll find them all here.
47.context: NodeContext: this is a sales pitch but he's also CLEARLY really proud to be part of the circus

76.speaker: Player
76.text: Why is a ghoul sniffing people?

52.speaker: Klaus
52.text: Oh, this is Benjamin! Say hi, Benji.

56.speaker: Klaus
56.text: Benji here checks all our patrons to make sure none of you are vicious murderers. Can't be too careful!

12.speaker: Klaus
12.text: But enough of this - the circus is a place of joy and distraction! So come inside and forget your worries.

24.speaker: Player
24.text: All right - I'd like to enter the circus.

75.speaker: Player
75.text: I'm not a murderer, I swear on the graves of my Father's sacrificial victims!

15.speaker: Player
15.text: Is this extra security because of the priest who was murdered?

41.speaker: Klaus
41.text: Oh, more than him got the knife. They say the Absolute's cronies have been busy chopping people up like it's going out of style.
41.context: NodeContext: sharing gossip, but not horrified knows he's protected)

94.speaker: Klaus
94.text: They won't go near us, of course - Lucretious, Bringer of Night, protects us.
94.context: NodeContext: pride and joy in his voice - he loves being part of the cirucs

124.speaker: Klaus
124.text: And even the Absolute knows better than to tangle with a necromancer.
124.context: NodeContext: completely convinced they are protected

59.speaker: Player
59.text: Are there a lot of murderers around?

86.speaker: Klaus
86.text: You haven't heard? The Absolute's cronies have been busy chopping people up like it's going out of style.
86.context: NodeContext: sharing gossip, but not horrified knows he's protected)

105.speaker: Player
105.text: Is now the time for a circus? The army of the Absolute is close.

33.speaker: Klaus
33.text: Well, when we zapped in, we didn't know there were religious zealots marching on the city. Slight inconvenience, that. But they're no threat to us.

23.speaker: Klaus
23.text: The Absolute's little murderers wouldn't dare.
23.context: NodeContext: confident - completely convinced that the absolute can't touch them

43.speaker: Player
43.text: I'd like to enter the circus.

2.speaker: Klaus
2.text: Not a problem, dear patron! Benji just has to check if you're a vicious murderer. Benji!

51.speaker: Benji
51.context: NodeContext: not a happy 'huh' - he doesn't like what he's smelling

37.speaker: Benji
37.text: BLOOD. TASTY BLOOD. SO DELICIOUS. AHAHAHA.
37.context: NodeContext: delighted. joyous. Almost like he's high.

58.speaker: Klaus
58.text: Killed before. But doesn't smell like a cultist. *Sigh.* Wanted to eat murderer...
58.context: NodeContext: breathing a touch heavy, the come down from a high. Rallies himself at the end of a line.

116.speaker: Klaus
116.text: Well, murderer or not, I can take no chances. I'm afraid you'll have to move along - no circus for you.

7.speaker: Benji
7.text: Urgh. Smells like a MUD FART.

113.speaker: Klaus
113.text: So, doesn't know the meaning of the word soap? Hmm. I don't fancy subjecting our patrons to such a stink.

93.speaker: Klaus
93.text: I'm afraid you'll have to move along - no circus for you.

48.speaker: Benji
48.text: Brain juice smells like PISS and IRON. NO. LIKE.

46.speaker: Klaus
46.text: That's a first. Usually I'd allow you in, but in these times I can take no chances. Move along - no circus for you.

19.speaker: Narrator
19.text: *You feel your patron bristle with a thousand briars at the rejection. It places some barbed words on your tongue - a weapon, should you need it.*

0.speaker: Player
0.text: I'm not a threat to you or anyone else in the circus - I swear it.

131.speaker: Klaus
131.text: Oh, damned if I'm not a sucker for big eyes and a heartfelt plea. Very well.
131.context: NodeContext: dramatic eye roll but also a smile

112.speaker: Klaus
112.text: That is just what a murderer would say. Alas, you cannot enter - move along or I'll feed you to Benji.
112.context: NodeContext: has refused player entry - no nonsense voice

90.speaker: Player
90.text: I used to be a killer, but I've reformed my ways.

6.speaker: Player
6.text: I used to be a killer, but I've reformed my ways.

80.speaker: Player
80.text: I'm a friend of Lord Gortash. I wonder what he'll say if I tell him about this...

62.speaker: Klaus
62.text: Oh, wait now, let's not be too hasty, shall we? Any friend of Gortash is a friend of ours.
62.context: NodeContext: nervous, backtracking - trying to get on the player's good side

85.speaker: Klaus
85.text: As if someone as lowly as you knows the likes of Lord Gortash. Move along - and not another word.
85.context: NodeContext: has refused player entry - stern and no nonsense

54.speaker: Player
54.text: I've actually just been hired. Meet your new bard!

57.speaker: Klaus
57.text: Ooof, Viola Silvertongue won't be happy. Oh well, she should have practised those high notes...

127.speaker: Klaus
127.text: Welcome to the circus - a motley crew of misfits and morons. We're happy to have you!
127.context: NodeContext: cheerful, gesturing behind him to the door. The big welcome to the circus!

4.speaker: Klaus
4.text: We look for talent in new hires, my friend - something you clearly lack. Next!
4.context: NodeContext: looking player up and down, unimpressed. At next, looks behind player - looking for the next customer.

25.speaker: Player
25.text: I've actually just been hired. I juggle knives.

64.speaker: Klaus
64.text: Ooof, I hope you're good. The redcaps got a little too excited when the last one nicked himself...

31.speaker: Player
31.text: I've actually just been hired. I do martial arts.

78.speaker: Player
78.text: I've actually just been hired. I do a magic show.

130.speaker: Klaus
130.text: Well, it's about time. I told Lucretious forever ago that we needed some more razz-ma-tazz on the big stage, you know? Glad she listened.

126.speaker: Player
126.text: I've just been hired as a firebreather. Let's hope nothing catches light.

98.speaker: Klaus
98.text: If someone blows up, blame Akabi the djinni - that's what I do.
98.context: NodeContext: smile and a cheeky wink

26.speaker: Player
26.text: It can probably smell the Weave within me. Just magical potential, that's all.

27.speaker: Player
27.text: Let me in, or I snap you in two.

49.speaker: Klaus
49.text: Forgive me, I must have, eh, misspoken.
49.context: NodeContext: player has ust threatened him - back tracking, trying to get on player's good sign

97.speaker: Klaus
97.text: Welcome to the Circus of the Last Days - have fun, and be sure to catch the star of our show, Dribbles the Clown!
97.context: NodeContext: cheerful, gesturing behind him to the door. The big welcome to the circus!

34.speaker: Klaus
34.context: NodeContext: ordering beni to attack/ eat the player

91.speaker: Benji
91.context: NodeContext: about to attack/eat the player. Delighted, excited, vicious

70.speaker: Player
70.text: You can smell the blood of my enemies, that is all. Want to join my scent?

120.speaker: Player
120.text: Surely we can come to an agreement? ([GEN_CheckMagicPocketGold_6057ad05-9492-4630-9f0a-be548b134c54])

1.speaker: Klaus
1.text: Well, it's a good thing I'm the agreeable sort, isn't it?
1.context: NodeContext: player has just bribed him. Delighted.

65.speaker: Player
65.text: I'd love to make a donation to the circus, but I seem to be a little short.

11.speaker: Klaus
11.text: You are more than welcome to return, my friend - when your pockets are less empty. Next!

20.speaker: Player
20.text: Unless you seek the wrath of the Seelie Court, you will let me pass.

60.speaker: Player
60.text: I never pass up a chance for a bit of faerie mischief - I'd like to enter.

117.speaker: Klaus
117.text: The traveller returns! None can resist the allure of the Circus of the Last Days. Enter and witness our extraplanar delights!

128.speaker: Klaus
128.text: Hello, hello, and welcome to the Circus of the Last Days - the finest extraplanar circus there is!
128.context: NodeContext: cheerful welcome - ready to make his big sales pitch about the circus
